column1: Volume 1 Population Table 4-1 Trends in population by sex: Japan，each prefecture -Total-
Note: 1) The population for each year is as of October 1. The Census populations are used for 1935，1947，1950 and every five years thereafter.
2) The values before 1965 indicate total population，whereas the values after 1970 indicate Japanese population.
3) The values for 1947 exclude survey omissions due to non-distribution in some regions.

4) The 73 people (39 males，34 females) in the disputed border area between Yamaguchi Village，Nishichikuma-gun，Nagano and Nakatsugawa City，Gifu in 1960 are included in the total population of the country，
but not in the population of Nagano or Gifu.

5) The values for 1970，1975，1980 and 1995 are the final populations of the Population Census. The values for 1990，2000，2005，2010 and 2015 are the final populations of the Population Census (prorated population).
The values for 2020 are the final populations of the Population Census (result with Imputation).
6) Each report for 1970，1975 and 1980 differs from the numbers in this table because the compiled result was based on 1% sample tabulation results.
7) In the figures for 1985，the national population indicates the Japanese populationand the population per prefecture indicates the total population，
and the“Preliminary Sample Tabulation of the 1985 Population Census” was used.
8) The population by prefecture was also changed to indicate the Japanese population from 2016 and the Population Estimates (as of October 1 each year) were used.
